decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing Mystic Forge in order to generate infinite mana and play powerful artifacts for free. By combining key cards like Voltaic Key, Grim Monolith, and Basalt Monolith with Mystic Forge, the deck can set up powerful combos that allow for a rapid and overwhelming victory. The artifacts in the deck provide utility and card advantage, while Karn, the Great Creator and Urza's Saga offer additional ways to tutor for important pieces. The deck's goal is to assemble the necessary components quickly to overwhelm the opponent with powerful artifact plays.

This deck focuses on assembling the combo of Nomads en-Kor and Nadu, Winged Wisdom to create infinite card draw, mana, and life. The deck also includes key pieces like Allosaurus Shepherd and Natural Order to protect and search for combo pieces. The deck's mana base is optimized for fast and consistent ramp with cards like Gaea's Cradle and Green Sun's Zenith. With the right setup, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with its powerful combo potential and efficient mana generation.

The main concept of this deck is to use the synergy between Cephalid Illusionist, Nomads en-Kor, and other cards to quickly mill through the deck and set up for a win condition with Dread Return or Thassa's Oracle. The deck focuses on controlling the game with counter spells like Force of Will and utilizing tutors like Urza's Saga to find key pieces. It also includes disruption with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Teferi, Time Raveler to stop opponents from interfering with the combo. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo and win the game in a short amount of time.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo to mill the opponent's entire deck. It utilizes cards like Goblin Welder and Goblin Engineer to manipulate artifacts in the graveyard, as well as other support cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Agatha's Soul Cauldron to generate value. Additionally, the deck includes disruption in the form of Pyroblast and Red Elemental Blast to control the opponent's spells. Overall, the strategy revolves around setting up the combo while controlling the game with various disruptive elements.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly playing aggressive creatures and disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Magus of the Moon. Utilizing the Companion mechanic with Yorion, Sky Nomad allows for extra value and synergy with flicker effects like Flickerwisp. Stoneforge Mystic helps search for powerful equipment like Kaldra Compleat and Chainsaw to further boost the deck's aggression. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes utility lands like Karakas and Wasteland. The deck aims to control the board and apply pressure to win the game quickly.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo using Mystic Forge to cast cards from the top of the library, while also utilizing artifacts such as Karn, the Great Creator, and Voltaic Key for additional synergy. The key strategy is to generate mana quickly through cards like Grim Monolith and Lotus Petal to play cards like Urza's Tower and Urza's Workshop, enabling the player to ramp up and quickly build a strong board presence. The deck is designed to efficiently chain together spells and artifacts to overwhelm the opponent and achieve victory.

The main idea of this deck is to achieve a powerful combo with Mystic Forge and various artifacts like Basalt Monolith, Grim Monolith, and The One Ring to generate a lot of mana and manipulate the top cards of your library to your advantage. The deck also includes cards like Glaring Fleshraker and Vexing Bauble for additional interaction and disruption, while cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Urza's Saga provide additional utility and value. The goal is to quickly assemble your combo pieces and overwhelm your opponent with a strong board presence and powerful abilities.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, then using cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back onto the battlefield for an explosive combo finish. The inclusion of disruption spells like Daze, Force of Will, and Thoughtseize helps protect the combo from being disrupted by opponents. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and provide options for fetching key lands like Underground Sea and Polluted Delta.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying threats and disrupting the opponent with powerful removal spells. The deck includes a mix of creatures that can generate card advantage, protect key pieces, and apply pressure on the opponent. With a robust mana base and the ability to utilize the Companion mechanic, the deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches. By utilizing efficient creatures and versatile removal spells, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents and secure victory through its aggressive playstyle.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. It aims to control the board with efficient removal like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay while also disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize. The deck also utilizes card advantage through cards like Brainstorm and Up the Beanstalk to ensure it can maintain control of the game. Additionally, it includes powerful threats like Murktide Regent to close out the game once it has stabilized the board.

This deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast and cheap threats while generating value through cascade effects. By utilizing cards like Shardless Agent and Violent Outburst, the deck can quickly put pressure on opponents and maintain card advantage. The inclusion of disruptive spells like Force of Will and Hullbreacher helps to control the game and protect your own threats. The deck's mana base is carefully constructed to support the aggressive game plan while also providing some utility with cards like Wasteland. Overall, the deck seeks to cascade into powerful spells and creatures to win the game quickly.

This UWx Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will while also controlling the board with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. The deck utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to generate advantage and control the game. It also includes a mix of card advantage engines like Brainstorm and Baleful Strix to keep the hand full. The deck aims to outlast the opponent and gain incremental advantages to eventually dominate the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing the combo potential of Nadu, Winged Wisdom to generate infinite mana and draw cards, while protecting the combo pieces with cards like Sylvan Safekeeper and Force of Will. The deck also includes cards like Delighted Halfling and Green Sun's Zenith to help assemble the combo and find key pieces. Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional control and disruption, while Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath offers additional card draw and ramp. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo and overwhelm the opponent with card advantage and powerful threats.

The main concept of this Legacy Combo - Painter deck is to quickly assemble the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo to mill the opponent's library. This can be achieved by utilizing cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker, Goblin Engineer, and The One Ring to tutor for the necessary pieces. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Pyroblast and Red Elemental Blast, as well as mana acceleration with Ancient Tomb and Lotus Petal. Overall, the deck aims to execute its combo efficiently and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing cards that disrupt your opponent's strategy, such as Stifle, Daze, and Force of Will. The key strategy revolves around playing a powerful creature like Phyrexian Dreadnought and using cards like Dress Down to protect it. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Nulldrifter provide card advantage and additional control options. The mana base is constructed to consistently hit all the necessary colors while also incorporating powerful land destruction with Wasteland. The goal is to outmaneuver your opponent and dictate the pace of the game.

This combo-reanimator deck focuses on quickly putting powerful creatures into play from the graveyard, while utilizing cards like Entomb, Reanimate, and Animate Dead to achieve this goal. Cards like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier provide strong threats that can swing the game in your favor. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Daze and Thoughtseize to control the game and protect your combo. The mana base includes fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent mana production while also disrupting opponent's mana sources with Wasteland.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly combo off and win the game by utilizing cards that allow for quick and explosive plays. By generating mana quickly with cards like Lotus Petal and Dark Ritual, and utilizing creatures like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to mill out the opponent's deck, the deck aims to win by either decking the opponent out or winning with Thassa's Oracle. Cards like Pact of Negation and Thoughtseize provide protection and disruption, while Reanimate and Dread Return allow for recurring threats from the graveyard.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures like Mother of Runes and Stoneforge Mystic to create a fast and aggressive board presence. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Spirit of the Labyrinth and Magus of the Moon to disrupt opponent's game plans. With a strong removal suite including Swords to Plowshares and Skyclave Apparition, this deck aims to control the board while applying pressure with efficient creatures. The addition of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion provides additional value and flexibility in longer games.

The primary strategy of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. By efficiently controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's resources, the deck aims to gradually gain advantage and outvalue the opponent. The inclusion of card advantage engines like Brainstorm and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, as well as threats like Murktide Regent, allows the deck to maintain pressure while controlling the game. The mana base is optimized for consistency and to support the deck's color requirements.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize high mana generating artifacts and spells to quickly bring out powerful legendary artifacts and permanents, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with counter spells and control elements. The key strategy lies in leveraging the synergy between artifacts like Grim Monolith and Coveted Jewel to generate immense mana, allowing for explosive plays like casting Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or assembling powerful artifact combos with cards like The One Ring and Paradox Engine. Show and Tell, Transmute Artifact, and Copy Artifact further support the deck's ability to quickly assemble and utilize its key pieces.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining pressure through aggressive creatures and efficient spells. It aims to control the game tempo by using cards like Thoughtseize, Daze, and Force of Will to interact with the opponent's spells, while creatures like Delver of Secrets and Murktide Regent put pressure on the opponent's life total. The deck also utilizes card draw and selection with Ponder, Brainstorm, and Nihil Spellbomb to find key pieces, and removal like Fatal Push to deal with threats. Additionally, the deck has some graveyard synergy with Reanimate and Nethergoyf.

The deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures and disruption spells to control the tempo of the game while applying pressure to the opponent. By combining aggressive creatures like Psychic Frog and Murktide Regent with disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a steady assault. With a mix of card draw, removal, and counter spells, the deck seeks to outmaneuver opponents and overwhelm them with a mix of creature threats and disruption spells.

This deck focuses on assembling the combo of using Doomsday to set up a winning sequence with Thassa's Oracle. It includes various card selection and mana acceleration cards to help find the necessary pieces quickly. The goal is to efficiently win the game through a compact series of spells, utilizing the power of Doomsday to manipulate the library and secure victory. The deck aims to quickly set up the combo and protect it with counter magic, while also being able to disrupt the opponent's game plan through disruption spells like Thoughtseize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupt their game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck also utilizes mana acceleration through cards like Lotus Petal and The One Ring to cast its high mana cost Eldrazi creatures ahead of schedule. Additionally, the deck includes land destruction with Wasteland and creature removal with cards like Sowing Mycospawn and Kozilek's Command to maintain control of the board and pressure the opponent.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize Mystic Forge in combination with various artifact cards such as Grim Monolith and Lotus Petal to generate mana and card advantage, enabling a powerful combo engine. Cards like Manifold Key and Voltaic Key can help untap artifacts and combo pieces, while Urza's Saga and Karn, the Great Creator provide additional ways to search for key artifact cards. Glaring Fleshraker acts as a disruptive element and provides an aggressive win condition. Overall, the deck aims to assemble a powerful artifact-based combo engine to overwhelm opponents.

The main concept of this deck is to use Mystic Forge in combination with artifacts like Grim Monolith, Basalt Monolith, and Paradox Engine to generate a lot of mana and eventually win the game with powerful artifacts like The One Ring and Karn, the Great Creator. Using cards like Manifold Key and Voltaic Key to untap artifacts, and Urza's Saga to search for key pieces, the deck aims to assemble its combo quickly and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful plays. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Kozilek's Command and control elements like Glaring Fleshraker to protect its combo.

The main concept of this Combo - Painter deck is to use cards like Painter's Servant and Grindstone to mill an opponent's entire library in one turn. Cards like Goblin Welder and Goblin Engineer help to search for and recur key combo pieces. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Pyroblast and Red Elemental Blast to protect the combo. It utilizes fast mana sources like Lion's Eye Diamond and Simian Spirit Guide to accelerate the combo. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and efficiently to win the game in a single turn.

The deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bring them back onto the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes disruptive spells like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect its combo pieces, while also having control elements like Swords to Plowshares and Daze. The deck also includes a variety of creatures with potent abilities to apply pressure and provide additional utility. Additionally, it runs a mix of dual lands and utility lands to ensure consistent mana production throughout the game.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Brainstorm, then bringing them back into play using reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. It utilizes disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its combo pieces and control the game. The deck also includes card draw and selection tools like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Thoughtseize to set up its combos efficiently. The key strategy is to reanimate big threats like Griselbrand and Archon of Cruelty to overwhelm the opponent and win the game.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, and then bringing them back onto the battlefield for a devastating attack. It includes protection spells like Force of Will and Daze to ensure the combo goes off smoothly. The key strategy is to efficiently reanimate a big threat like Archon of Cruelty or Atraxa, Grand Unifier to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures early in the game. The deck aims to win the game quickly before the opponent can establish their own board presence.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bringing them back onto the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent. It also includes disruption elements like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to control the game and protect the combo. The key strategy is to efficiently use reanimation spells to cheat powerful creatures into play early in the game, putting pressure on the opponent and setting up for a quick victory. The deck aims to win through explosive combos and overwhelming board presence.

The deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures, then use various spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back onto the battlefield for a big advantage. It also includes disruption cards like Stifle and Force of Will to protect the combo and control the opponent's plays. The deck prioritizes efficient and versatile spells to quickly execute its game plan and overwhelm the opponent with high-impact creatures. It leverages the graveyard as a resource and aims to win the game through the power of reanimation and combo plays.

The deck focuses on assembling the Cephalid Breakfast combo using cards like Nomads en-Kor, Cephalid Illusionist, and Narcomoeba to mill the library, then use Dread Return to bring back Thassa's Oracle for the win. The rest of the deck includes card draw like Brainstorm and Ponder, protection with Force of Will, and interaction with Swords to Plowshares. Teferi, Time Raveler helps protect the combo, while Urza's Saga provides additional utility. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo while controlling the game with counterspells and removal.

This deck focuses on assembling the Cephalid Breakfast combo using cards like Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to manipulate the library and graveyard. This combo enables players to mill their entire library and win the game by either drawing a card with Thassa's Oracle or recurring cards with Dread Return. The deck also includes cards for protection and disruption, such as Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares, allowing the player to control the game while setting up their combo. Urza's Saga and Teferi, Time Raveler provide additional utility to support the combo strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly comboing off using Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill your library, triggering Narcomoeba and creating a loop with Dread Return targeting Thassa's Oracle to win the game. It includes protection spells like Force of Will to protect your combo, along with disruption like Swords to Plowshares and Teferi, Time Raveler. Urza's Saga helps find the pieces you need, while cards like Brainstorm and Ponder dig for your combo pieces. The deck combines fast combo potential with control elements to take down opponents in Legacy 1 vs 1 matchups.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while maintaining a fast pace with efficient and aggressive creatures. It utilizes spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the board, along with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its own threats. The deck also includes card draw and card selection with Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistency. The key strategy is to apply pressure early with creatures like Delver of Secrets and Nethergoyf, while using disruptive spells to keep the opponent on the back foot.

This deck focuses on playing disruptive creatures and spells to control the pace of the game while also quickly dealing damage to the opponent. The key strategy is to efficiently use resources like Force of Will and Daze to protect your threats, such as Murktide Regent and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck also utilizes cards like Brainstorm and Thoughtseize to dig for key pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The aggro-tempo strategy is further supported by removal spells like Fatal Push and Sudden Edict to maintain board presence and pressure the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining tempo with efficient removal and countermagic. By utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Stifle, Daze, and Force of Will, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect its own threats. With a focus on early interaction and efficient threats like Brazen Borrower and Nethergoyf, the deck aims to control the game and put pressure on the opponent to stay ahead. The deck also includes some graveyard hate with Nihil Spellbomb to disrupt any potential graveyard strategies from the opponent.

This Dimir Tempo deck focuses on utilizing disruptive elements like Daze, Force of Will, and Thoughtseize to control the game while efficiently deploying threats like Murktide Regent and Nethergoyf to quickly close out the game. By combining efficient removal in Fatal Push and targeted disruption in Brainstorm, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a strong board presence. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and utility, while Brazen Borrower offers tempo plays and flexibility. Overall, this deck aims to be aggressive, disruptive, and versatile in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board while also maintaining a strong tempo advantage. Utilizing a mix of removal spells like Fatal Push and counterspells like Force of Will, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while developing its own board presence. Murktide Regent and Nethergoyf provide substantial threats, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps with card advantage and filtering. The mana base is optimized for flexibility and consistency, allowing for smooth play and efficient use of resources. Overall, the deck thrives on disrupting the opponent's strategy and maintaining pressure.

The main concept of this Doomsday combo deck is to dig through the deck quickly to find and play Doomsday, then set up a winning pile with Thassa's Oracle. The deck focuses on control elements to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck includes cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder, as well as disruption with Counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also includes ways to tutor for specific cards like Thoughtseize and Reanimate to further enhance the combo potential.

The key strategy revolves around utilizing the card Doomsday to carefully stack your deck in a way that allows you to win the game by drawing Thassa's Oracle and winning the game by having no cards left in your library. The deck runs multiple ways to protect this combo, including counterspells like Force of Will and Daze, removal spells like Fatal Push, and card selection spells like Brainstorm and Ponder. By carefully planning out your Doomsday stack and protecting your win condition, you can outpace and outmaneuver your opponent to victory.

The main concept of this Dragon Stompy deck is to quickly play disruptive cards like Magus of the Moon and Blood Moon to shut down opponents' mana bases, while also utilizing high-powered creatures like Broadside Bombardiers and Fury to deal damage quickly and efficiently. By ramping out threats with cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Chrome Mox, and utilizing burn spells like Sundering Eruption and Shatterskull Smashing, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents and win the game through aggressive plays and powerful creatures.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures quickly, utilizing mana acceleration from cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb. Chalice of the Void disrupts opponent's spells, while Thought-Knot Seer provides hand disruption. The deck also includes cards like Sowing Mycospawn and Glaring Fleshraker for efficient aggression. Eye of Ugin and Eldrazi Temple help to reduce the cost of Eldrazi creatures, allowing for explosive plays. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with large threats and disrupt their game plan with control elements like Chalice of the Void.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures quickly to overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes a mix of Eldrazi creatures, mana acceleration with Lotus Petal and Mox Diamond, disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void, and land destruction with Wasteland. The goal is to play aggressively and utilize the powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Glaring Fleshraker to control the game and deal massive damage to the opponent. The deck aims to apply pressure early on and maintain that pressure throughout the game to secure a victory.

This deck is focused on playing aggressively with a mix of threats that can quickly put pressure on the opponent. It includes disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its creatures while also utilizing cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig for more threats. The deck includes a mix of efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt to deal with opposing creatures. The main win conditions are Delver of Secrets, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Murktide Regent, supported by disruption and card advantage to maintain tempo and pressure the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble powerful combos involving Mystic Forge and various artifact cards such as Manifold Key, Voltaic Key, and Paradox Engine. By using cards like Grim Monolith and Urza's Saga to generate mana quickly, the deck aims to control the board with creatures like Glaring Fleshraker and use Karn, the Great Creator to shut down opposing strategies. The synergy between artifacts and the ability to generate mana efficiently allows the deck to quickly assemble its game-winning combos and overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo using Mystic Forge and various artifact cards such as Glaring Fleshraker, Grim Monolith, and The One Ring to generate massive amounts of mana and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Manifold Key and Voltaic Key to untap key artifacts, the deck can create explosive turns that overwhelm opponents. The inclusion of cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Planar Nexus further enhance the deck's ability to control the board and ensure victory through powerful synergies and efficient combo plays.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo utilizing Mystic Forge and various artifact untap effects to generate huge amounts of mana. By utilizing cards like Glaring Fleshraker and Kozilek's Command to control the board, the deck is able to consistently ramp up and generate a game-winning board state. The inclusion of cards like The One Ring and Urza's Saga provide additional utility and power to the deck's strategy, while cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Planar Nexus provide additional versatility and control options.

The main concept of this deck revolves around using Mystic Forge and combo pieces like Grim Monolith, Basalt Monolith, and Voltaic Key to generate infinite mana and play out the entire deck in one turn. Glaring Fleshraker and Vexing Bauble provide additional sources of card advantage and disruption. The deck revolves around the interaction between Mystic Forge and various mana-generating artifacts like Grim Monolith and Basalt Monolith. The key strategy is to use cards like Manifold Key and Voltaic Key to untap mana-producing artifacts and continuously play spells from the top of the library using Mystic Forge. The deck also includes ways to tutor specific artifacts with Urza's Saga and Karn, the Great Creator, as well as disruptive elements like Glaring Fleshraker and Pithing Needle. The goal is to generate a powerful board state and overwhelm the opponent with efficient combo plays.

This Legacy deck focuses on utilizing the combo potential of Nadu, Winged Wisdom alongside Nomads en-Kor to create a powerful engine for card draw and mana acceleration. The deck also includes control elements like Swords to Plowshares and Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt opponents' strategies. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's needs while also providing flexibility in color options.

The deck focuses on assembling a combo with Nadu, Winged Wisdom by using cards like Nomads en-Kor and Springheart Nantuko to draw cards and generate mana. This combo can be tutored for with Chord of Calling and Green Sun's Zenith, while also having access to Natural Order to fetch Craterhoof Behemoth for a game-winning attack. The deck also includes disruptive creatures like Collector Ouphe and Endurance to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, the deck runs a suite of mana accelerants like Noble Hierarch and Gaea's Cradle to quickly deploy its threats.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Griselbrand, using cards like Entomb and Faithless Looting. Then, it uses spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring these creatures back onto the battlefield for a powerful combo finish. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Unmask to protect the combo. The mana base is designed to support these strategies, with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistency in casting the necessary spells.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling mana through ritual spells and fast mana sources to cast a large number of spells in a single turn, ultimately leading to a massive storm count. This storm count is then used to cast Tendrils of Agony or use Burning Wish to access a lethal spell from the sideboard, allowing the player to win the game in one explosive turn. The deck also includes disruption in the form of discard spells like Thoughtseize and Duress to protect the combo and ensure a clear path to victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures such as Griselbrand, Atraxa, Grand Unifier, and Archon of Cruelty using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then bring them back onto the battlefield using Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck also includes disruption spells like Daze and Force of Will to protect the combo. The mana base is optimized for fetching necessary lands and filling the graveyard efficiently. This deck aims to reanimate big threats early in the game to overwhelm the opponent and win quickly.

It aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful, game-winning creatures.

It aims to win the game through explosive, game-ending plays.

The main objective of this deck is to quickly and efficiently fill the graveyard with powerful creatures and then bring them back into play through reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. By using cards like Entomb and Brainstorm to set up the graveyard, the deck aims to cheat out creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Griselbrand early in the game. Cards like Force of Will and Daze help protect the combo pieces, while cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push control the opponent's cards. The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Brainstorm, then bring them back to the battlefield with cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes counter and removal spells like Force of Will and Fatal Push to protect its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. This combo deck focuses on milling your own library to get key cards like Narcomoeba and Thassa's Oracle into play, along with Poxwalkers and Undercity Informer to fuel the graveyard recursion. Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal help ramp into these plays, while Pact of Negation protects the combo. Sink into Stupor and Thoughtseize disrupt opponents' game plans, while Memory's Journey can protect against graveyard hate. The goal is to then win with a massive dread return combo or through alternate win conditions like Jack-o'-Lantern and Fell the Profane.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize fast mana sources such as Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond to generate storm count and cast powerful spells like Tendrils of Agony or Song of Creation to win the game. This deck also includes cards like Echo of Eons and Beseech the Mirror to help find the key pieces needed for the combo. Additionally, the deck features disruption with cards like Veil of Summer to protect the combo and Burning Wish to access sideboard cards for specific situations. The mana base includes a mix of dual lands and fetch lands to consistently produce the required colors of mana.

The main concept of this BUG Control Legacy deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan using counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. By utilizing cards like Force of Will, Fatal Push, and Brainstorm, you can control the board and protect your own threats. The deck also includes a mix of creatures like Murktide Regent and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to apply pressure and generate card advantage. With a versatile toolbox of cards like Nihil Spellbomb and Witherbloom Command, you can adapt to various matchups and come out on top in 1 vs 1 games.

This deck focuses on using the Cephalid Illusionist combo to mill your library and then win the game with Thassa's Oracle. The deck includes cards like Nomads en-Kor and Shuko to facilitate the combo, as well as protection spells like Force of Will and Daze to ensure success. Urza's Saga is used to tutor for key pieces of the combo, while cards like Swords to Plowshares offer removal and disruption. Teferi, Time Raveler helps to protect the combo from disruption, creating a streamlined and efficient win condition.

The main objective of this deck is to use the combo of Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill through the deck quickly, filling up the graveyard with Narcomoebas and allowing for a quick Thassa's Oracle win. The deck includes protection and card draw spells such as Force of Will and Brainstorm to help navigate through disruption, while also utilizing cards like Urza's Saga and Teferi, Time Raveler for additional value. The deck aims to assemble the combo pieces quickly and efficiently to win the game in a single turn.

The main objective of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo of Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill the library, then use cards like Narcomoeba and Thassa's Oracle to win the game instantly. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to protect the combo or disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Urza's Saga and Teferi, Time Raveler provide additional utility and flexibility in different game situations. The deck aims to efficiently execute its combo while controlling the board and opponent's actions.

The focus of this deck is to utilize the Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor combo to mill your own library, triggering Narcomoeba to pop onto the battlefield. This sets up for a win with either Thassa's Oracle or Dread Return. The deck also includes protection with Force of Will and Daze, alongside interaction with Swords to Plowshares. The addition of Urza's Saga and Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional utility and card advantage. The mana base includes various fetchlands and dual lands for consistency in casting spells.

The deck focuses on quickly and efficiently comboing off using Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill the library, while using cards like Narcomoeba and Dread Return to win the game. The deck includes protection in the form of Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares, as well as card selection with Brainstorm and Ponder. Urza's Saga helps find necessary combo pieces, while Tamiyo and Thassa's Oracle provide additional ways to win the game. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Daze and Teferi to control the game and ensure the combo goes off smoothly.

The main goal of this deck is to establish control over the game while utilizing the powerful Gaea's Cradle mana engine. By combining mana acceleration from cards like Noble Hierarch and Elvish Reclaimer with disruptive creatures like Collector Ouphe and Endurance, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and eventually overwhelm them with threats like Craterhoof Behemoth and Wight of the Reliquary. The inclusion of cards like Natural Order and Green Sun's Zenith provide flexibility and the ability to tutor for key creatures, making it a versatile and resilient control deck in Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

The main focus of this deck is to use powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Craterhoof Behemoth to establish board control and overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Elvish Reclaimer, Wight of the Reliquary, and Green Sun's Zenith, the deck aims to quickly ramp up mana production with Gaea's Cradle and efficiently search for key cards. Control elements like Endurance and Collector Ouphe provide disruption for the opponent's strategy, while Natural Order and Once Upon a Time ensure consistent access to game-winning creatures. The deck's strategy revolves around maximizing the efficiency of the Gaea's Cradle engine and leveraging its powerful synergy with the deck's key creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to control the tempo of the game by disrupting the opponent's plays while applying pressure with aggressive threats like Nethergoyf and Murktide Regent. The deck utilizes disruptive spells like Force of Will, Daze, and Stifle to keep the opponent off balance, while also having removal spells like Fatal Push to deal with threats. The inclusion of Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and helps dig for key cards. The mana base is built around efficient lands like Underground Sea and Wasteland to support the deck's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through control elements like Force of Will and Daze, while also maintaining a tempo advantage with efficient threats like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent. The deck aims to control the board through removal spells like Fatal Push and disruption cards like Thoughtseize, all while generating card advantage with cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Psychic Frog. This deck focuses on utilizing disruptive spells and efficient creatures to control the pace of the game while applying pressure to the opponent. The main concept of this Dimir Tempo deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure to their life total. The deck can also utilize Psychic Frog to control the opponent's draw step and disrupt their game plan.

The main focus of this Dragon Stompy deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base and quickly overwhelm them with aggressive creatures and powerful spells. By utilizing cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Sundering Eruption, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan while building its own board presence. The inclusion of dragons like Laelia, the Blade Reforged and Broadside Bombardiers adds a big threat in the late game, while cards like Fury and Pyrogoyf provide additional aggression in the early turns. Overall, this deck aims to control the pace of the game and secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana through cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Chrome Mox to cast powerful dragon creatures like Broadside Bombardiers and Laelia, the Blade Reforged. The main focus of this deck is to leverage the powerful Eldrazi creatures to put pressure on the opponent quickly, while disrupting their game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. This deck focuses on playing powerful Eldrazi creatures quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive threats. This deck aims to put pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures while disrupting their game plan using cards like Hushbringer and Spirit of the Labyrinth. The key concept of this deck is to assemble a powerful combo using Mystic Forge in combination with cards like Basalt Monolith, Voltaic Key, and Grim Monolith to generate infinite mana and card advantage. Karn, the Great Creator and Urza's Saga provide additional synergies and utility, while cards like Pithing Needle and Kozilek's Command help control the board. The deck aims to use this combo to overwhelm the opponent with strong artifacts and creatures like Glaring Fleshraker, ultimately leading to victory through a combination of resource advantage and powerful threats.

The main concept of this deck revolves around using Mystic Forge in combination with artifact mana ramp (Grim Monolith, Basalt Monolith, Lotus Petal) and ways to manipulate artifacts (Manifold Key, Voltaic Key) to generate an advantage over the opponent. The goal is to quickly assemble a powerful board state with artifacts like The One Ring and Glaring Fleshraker, while also utilizing Planar Nexus and Urza's Saga to control the battlefield. Karn, the Great Creator and Kozilek's Command provide additional disruption and utility in this fast-paced combo deck.

The main concept of this deck is to generate mana quickly using artifacts like Basalt Monolith and Grim Monolith, while also taking advantage of cards like Mystic Forge and Karn, the Great Creator to assemble powerful combos. The deck also utilizes cards like Manifold Key and Voltaic Key to untap artifacts and use them multiple times in a turn. Additionally, the inclusion of Kozilek's Command and Urza's Saga provides disruption and card advantage, allowing the deck to control the game while setting up its win condition.

The deck focuses on using Mystic Forge and various key artifacts to generate infinite mana and card advantage, ultimately leading to a game-winning combo or lockout. Glaring Fleshraker and The One Ring are crucial pieces in the combo, while cards like Grim Monolith and Basalt Monolith help ramp up mana production. Urza's Saga and Karn, the Great Creator provide additional utility and search power. Overall, the deck aims to create a powerful engine that can overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces of Nomads en-Kor and Nadu, Winged Wisdom to generate infinite card draw. The key strategy of this Legacy 1 vs 1 deck is to assemble the combo involving Nadu, Winged Wisdom alongside Nomads en-Kor and Delighted Halfling to draw cards and generate value. Green Sun's Zenith and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provide additional value, while the mana base includes a mix of dual lands and fetch lands for consistency and flexibility.

It also includes protection with cards like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares, as well as ramp and fixing with cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Teferi, Time Raveler. The deck focuses on utilizing creatures with the ability to generate additional mana to ramp into powerful finishers like Craterhoof Behemoth and Nadu, Winged Wisdom. It uses a combination of mana dorks, tutors like Chord of Calling and Green Sun's Zenith, and combo pieces like Nomads en-Kor and Allosaurus Shepherd to create explosive turns and overwhelm the opponent. The deck aims to quickly build up a board presence and then close out the game with a game-ending threat like Craterhoof Behemoth backed up by cards like Natural Order and Finale of Devastation.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the combo of Nadu, Winged Wisdom and Delighted Halfling to generate infinite mana and draw your entire deck. This allows you to find and play your win condition, such as Green Sun's Zenith for a massive creature or Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath for card advantage and life gain. The deck also includes disruption in the form of counterspells and removal to protect your combo pieces and disrupt your opponent's game plan. The mana base is designed to support the various colors needed for the combo and interaction spells.

The deck focuses on using Nomads en-Kor and Delighted Halfling to combo off with Nadu, Winged Wisdom to draw through the entire deck and win the game in one turn. It includes disruption in the form of Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares, along with card selection tools like Brainstorm and Ponder. The deck also runs powerful green utility cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional disruption and protection for the combo. Teferi, Time Raveler helps protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent. The deck also includes interaction like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to control the game and prevent the opponent from stopping the combo. The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo to mill the opponent's library. It also includes various cards to support the combo, such as Goblin Engineer and Pyroblast. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo while using cards like Urza's Saga to find key pieces. Additionally, it includes some disruption elements like Ensnaring Bridge and Lightning Bolt to control the opponent's board. Overall, the deck focuses on assembling the combo efficiently to defeat the opponent.

The main goal of this deck is to assemble the powerful combo of Painter's Servant and Grindstone to mill an opponent's entire deck in one turn. This is facilitated by cards like Goblin Engineer and Goblin Welder, while also providing disruption through Pyroblast and Red Elemental Blast. The deck is built around quickly assembling and protecting the combo, while also having backup win conditions like Chaos Defiler and Phyrexian Dragon Engine. The use of mana acceleration and disruption spells helps the deck maintain control and set up fast wins.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly get powerful creatures into the graveyard and then reanimate them onto the battlefield for a game-winning advantage. By using cards like Entomb, Reanimate, Animate Dead, and Dark Ritual, the deck can efficiently cheat out creatures like Griselbrand, Atraxa, Grand Unifier, and Valgavoth, Terror Eater. This combo-reanimator strategy aims to overwhelm opponents with massive threats early in the game, putting pressure on them to respond or face defeat. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Unmask and Thoughtseize to control the game and ensure its combo can go off smoothly.

The deck aims to use the combination of Show and Tell, Omniscience, and Sneak Attack to cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier onto the battlefield early in the game. It also includes cards like Vexing Bauble, Lotus Petal, and Simian Spirit Guide to accelerate mana production and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of control elements like Force of Will, Brainstorm, and Ponder, the deck seeks to quickly overwhelm the opponent with massive threats and close out the game before they can respond effectively.

The deck focuses on cheating powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Archon of Cruelty into play quickly through cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. Combo pieces like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and The One Ring help facilitate the combo while protection is provided through counterspells like Force of Will. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with big threats while disrupting their game plan with cards like Spell Pierce. The mana base is designed to support the combo pieces and ensure the deck can execute its game plan efficiently.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's resources and preventing their game plan from advancing, using cards like Stifle and Force of Will to disrupt key plays. The deck also includes card draw and selection tools like Brainstorm and Ponder to find the necessary pieces, as well as removal spells like Swords to Plowshares to deal with threats. The deck is focused on generating a high amount of storm count through efficient mana acceleration and cantrips such as Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain. It aims to assemble the key cards needed for a lethal Tendrils of Agony or Past in Flames combo finish, using cards like Dark Ritual and Cabal Ritual to generate mana and Infernal Tutor to search for the necessary pieces. Protection is provided through cards like Duress and Thoughtseize, while Veil of Summer helps against counterspells. Wishclaw Talisman can also be used to tutor for key combo pieces.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with key creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bringing them back into play for a powerful effect. It combines powerful reanimation spells with disruptive countermagic like Force of Will to protect its game plan. The deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies while quickly reanimating high-impact creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Valgavoth, Terror Eater. It also includes cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to help dig for combo pieces and lands. Overall, the deck excels at combining speed and disruption to overwhelm opponents.

Once these creatures are in the graveyard, the deck aims to bring them back into play through spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead, allowing for explosive plays and overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Force of Will and Daze to protect its combo pieces and ensure a successful reanimation strategy.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures through cards like Entomb and Brainstorm, then bringing them back into play with Reanimate and Animate Dead. The main goal of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using Entomb and Brainstorm, then use reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back into play.
